Simulate latent process with noise

simulate.ngme_model.Rd

Simulate latent process with noise

Usage

# S3 method for ngme_model
simulate(object, nsim = 1, seed = NULL, ...)

Arguments

object

ngme model specified by f() function

nsim

ignored

seed

seed

...

ignored

Value

a realization of latent model

Examples

B_sigma <- matrix(1:10 / 10, nrow=10)
simulate(noise_nig(n = 10, B_sigma =  B_sigma))
#>  [1] -0.47134717  0.41616759 -2.24037074  0.54555204  1.55801595 -2.27653745
#>  [7]  0.03691396 -0.43067938 -0.07639631  1.77538987
#> attr(,"noise")
#> Noise type - nig
#> Noise parameters: 
#>     mu = 0
#>     sigma = 1
#>     nu = 1
simulate(noise_normal(theta_sigma = 1.5, B_sigma = B_sigma))
#>  [1] -1.37054135 -0.33509480 -0.93027045  0.63274999 -0.79386299  1.74796754
#>  [7]  0.09055596  1.97281974 -4.07561030 -3.56718057
#> attr(,"noise")
#> Noise type - normal
#> Noise parameters: 
#>     sigma = 4.48
simulate(f(1:10, model = "ar1", theta_K = 0.4, noise = noise_nig()))
#>  [1] -0.1764355  0.5716391  0.5871423 -2.4705154 -3.2366572 -2.3110962
#>  [7] -0.6105095  0.6896104  0.8315281  0.9843390
#> attr(,"noise")
#> Noise type - nig
#> Noise parameters: 
#>     mu = 0
#>     sigma = 1
#>     nu = 1
